body:
### Problem

Possible use of uninitialized memory with 'linebreak' and 'vartabstop', causing the test failure in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/7756176352/job/21152983570?pr=27303
```
 Failures: 
	From test_vartabs.vim:
	Found errors in Test_vartabs_linebreak():
	command line..script D:/a/neovim/neovim/test/old/testdir/runtest.vim[543]..function RunTheTest[55]..Test_vartabs_linebreak[20]..<SNR>4_compare_lines line 1: Expected '>---------x>------------------          \nx>------------------x>------------------\nx\[  occurs 39 times]' but got '>---------ͪ�x>------------------          \nx>------------------x>------------------\nx\[  occurs 39 times]'
```
Valgrind:

### Steps to reproduce

`make oldtest TEST_FILE=test_vartabs.vim USE_VALGRIND=1`

### Expected behavior

No use of uninitialized memory

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

N/A

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No

### Operating system/version

N/A

### Terminal name/version

N/A

### $TERM environment variable

N/A

### Installation

N/A
title: Possible use of uninitialized memory with 'linebreak' and 'vartabstop'
